author: barnabasbusa
content:
Fusaka-devnet-2 update:

All nimbus and nimbusel nodes are offline / or producing orphaned blocks.
Lots of reth nodes are struggling to peer up with other ELs.

author: agnxsh
content:
We are falling out of sync and the issue is known, our long range syncing is heavily dependent on light client which is OFF for this devnet because of the new fork digest changes.

Should take a couple of days to be fully fixed

author: agnxsh
content: are CLs dropping statusv1 support post FULU? <@&1367819082019377202>

author: manunlp
content: More generally, when a new version of a message (StatusV2, MetadataV3) is introduced in a fork, should/may clients stop supporting the previous one?

author: manunlp
content: For example, Prysm already does not support any more Blocks By Range V1.

author: manunlp
content: Or Metadata V1

author: agnxsh
content: i think we should keep things backward compatible, just in case some protocol uses something in a fairly critical sense. for example, we don't really need earliest available slot for now in fulu, to sync, the peer rotation and switching should suffice the column sync, hence we never cared to actually use statusV2 and to only serve statusV2 correctly

author: agnxsh
content: imo, the usage of statusV1 -> statusV2 is fairly fast paced and rushed in a sense, atleast we should support the former for a while, for a few devnets

author: agnxsh
content: atleast

author: mariusvanderwijden
content: Whats the timeline for devnet-3?

author: barnabasbusa
content: once we have 7907 repricings values set, we can set the timeline for devnet 3

author: tersec
content: after alpha.3

author: agnxsh
content: any estimates? i need to work some cleanups, optimizations meanwhile

author: agnxsh
content: and not just the latest spec

author: barnabasbusa
content: CL side there aren't any changes afaik for devnet 3

author: barnabasbusa
content: all the clarifications were already in devnet 2

author: agnxsh
content: oh ok

author: agnxsh
content: thanks

author: jtraglia
content: <@785811170387951616> <@531934490826768418> <@412614104222531604> Is it worth defining in the specifications when when StatusV1 is considered deprecated & is no longer expected to be used? We don't typically say this in the specs. I think we can drop StatusV1 support at the fork.

author: agnxsh
content: i think we should either mention it in spec about the deprecation/ or wait a couple more releases to be fully deprecated as the change is literally 1 week old

author: jtraglia
content: I don't really understand. It's not like we're deprecating V1 right now. Why does a couple more releases matter?

author: agnxsh
content: i can't speak for other CLs but right now we are not really using statusV2 to sync, and to fully utilise earliest available slot from status v2 in our sync mechanism, we need a bit more time imo, 2 releases worth of time atleast

author: agnxsh
content: which is why i'm suggesting to proceed with v1 deprecation to be a bit gradual

author: agnxsh
content:
> It's not like we're deprecating V1 right now
there are a few cls that i can notice that aren't agreeing on v1 post fulu in the devnet, <@531934490826768418> agreed that prysm doesn't

author: jtraglia
content: So this is just a current devnet issue.

author: agnxsh
content: since, it's been raised, yes

author: agnxsh
content: and since it's visible
